content:
This document provides an overview of camera control in Panda3D, explaining how the camera node can be manipulated as a .PandaNode and discussing the two NodePaths (base.cam and base.camera) used to represent the camera in ShowBase. It emphasizes controlling the base.camera node for typical operations.

Camera Control

Panda3D's camera is considered a .PandaNode. It can therefore be manipulated as any other node.

The actual camera is defined in ShowBase as a .NodePath named base.cam <direct.showbase.ShowBase.ShowBase.cam>. There is also a plain node above the camera, which is a NodePath called base.camera <direct.showbase.ShowBase.ShowBase.camera>. Generally you want to control the latter with your code.
